text: Mikantji is a waterhole in the Northern Territory of Australia. It is an important sacred site for Warlpiri-speaking Aborigines. The site features in their Dreaming stories. Fire- and rain-making rituals are performed here by the Warlpiri. Mikantji is located about northwest of Yuendumu, on the road coming north from Papunya. ==References== Category:Geography of the Northern Territory Category:Indigenous Australian culture Category:Waterholes of Australia
title: Mikantji
